roleset.name: (cause to be) tending towards, wanting

roles.note: If an agent ever comes up, call it argA like in the verb frame. Unlike the verb frame, I think it is extremely unlikely to occur in the nominalization. Arg2 added due to usage with nominalization.

example.name: args 0 and 2
example.text: I suspect you are wrong on the voting inclinations of the moderates , and especially the ones you call tea baggers .
example.note: "voting" doesn't tell us how arg0 is inclined to vote, just that the inclination has to do with voting. This is the difference between arg1 and arg2.

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: The St John's Grove families have divided loyalties: we are members of two parties and with voting inclinations towards a third.
example.note: See, you can have both arg1 and arg2 at the same time.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT, incline.01. Corresponds to VNcls addict-96.
